item.title: Temp traffic lights, 9th November
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights still in place after works Completed 6 hours ago ,spoil gone ,plastic barriers removed just the lights to go ? if still in place peek Hours Monday morning it s going to bring Cheltenham Road East to a standstill , Please please remove them ASAP??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.description:

item.title: The back of Sainsbury's an abandoned caravan, 9th November
item.description:
There is an abandoned caravan next to the star college behind Sainsbury's that has smashed windows and is getting more and more smashed each day. I gather it's abandoned as it's been there ages on its own.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrove Way, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.title: Fly tipping, 9th November
item.description:
A person came from the new estate next to the old Arle nurseries and dumped a big troll full of junk next to the park. I thought it was a pushchair at first until I went by with my dog and it's a big cart/ troll full of house hold junk that the person on foot just left. At the beginning of Pilgrove way next to the playground. Unfortunately I didn't have my phone on me as I would have taken a photo
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrove Way, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge not being maintained, 9th November
item.description:
The grass verge at the junction of Hayfield Way and Ashlea Meadow in Bishops Cleeve (on each side of the pavement that leads partially to the house at 1 May Hill Drive) has not been cut this year, so the area is now overgrown and contains large weeds. This small area of verge in front of the property was cut in previous years by Tewkesbury Borough Council, along with the other grass verges in Hayfield Way. However I understand that this responsibility changed in 2025 to Glos County Council, and although the main verges have since been cut, this small area in front of 1 May Hill Drive has not. Maybe the grass cutting contractor now employed for this job, is unaware that this area of verge is part of the council's responsibility. I hope this oversight can be attended to at your earliest opportunity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Hayfield Way, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: Yet more fly tipping., 8th November
item.description:
This is the THIRD TIME SINCE MONDAY that rubbish has been dumped here. Why does CBC do absolutely nothing to try and catch and prosecute those responsible for creating this eyesore? Fly tipping is a criminal offence. This location is a well known hot spot for fly tipping. Why not put up a covert camera, catch them and fine them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Pates Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
